name: correlative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If two or more facts, numbers, etc. are correlative, there is an important relationship between them: Each time the card is presented to the card reader it produces a correlative number. Individuals who wish to be protected by the law have a correlative duty to obey the law.
More examplesFewer examples"Subject" and "object" are correlative terms.Freedom can only be exercised in a way that is consistent with its correlative obligation to society.

Related word
correlate
a fact, number, etc. that has an important relationship to another fact, number, etc.: correlative of She views death as the natural correlative of life. His compositions are musical correlatives of prayer and meditation.
More examplesFewer examplesShe argues that science and religion are necessary correlatives.

Related word
correlate
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe two or more things that are related to each other: Each party to the contract has correlative rights and duties.
